    • Downloading and organizing a collection of NCBI pathogen genomes

    Get pangenome representatives from a gene_vec_tibble

    get_pangenome_representatives2.Rd

    Get pangenome representatives from a gene_vec_tibble

    get_pangenome_representatives2(
  gene_vec_tibble,
  desired_coverage = 0.95,
  SEED = 3,
  best_possible_score = NULL
)

    Arguments

    gene_vec_tibble

    an object returned by pan_mat_to_gene_vec_tibble()

    desired_coverage

    proportion of gene content desired 0-1

    SEED

    random seed to use (for selecting 1st genome)

    best_possible_score

    to save time you can pre-calculate the best possible score (total gene content of pangenome)

    Value

    a list of 3; list(cumulative_genomes, scores, proportion_coverages)

    Examples

    generate_pangenome() %>% pan_mat_to_gene_vec_tibble() %>% get_pangenome_representatives2()
#> [1] "calculating total number of genes, you can speed this up if you supply the best_possible_score parameter"
#> [1] "99 total genomes"
#> [1] "1000 = best possible score"
#> [1] "0.95 = desired coverage"
#> [1] "950 = desired score"
#> [1] "starting score = 776"
#> [1] "new score = 871"
#> [1] "proportion covered = 0.871"
#> [1] "new score = 919"
#> [1] "proportion covered = 0.919"
#> [1] "new score = 948"
#> [1] "proportion covered = 0.948"
#> [1] "new score = 970"
#> [1] "proportion covered = 0.97"
#> [[1]]
#> [1] "genome_59" "genome_27" "genome_46" "genome_69" "genome_38"
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 776 871 919 948 970
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 0.776 0.871 0.919 0.948 0.970
#>
